plugins.name: Live Flip Clock
plugins.description: Bring a touch of style and functionality to your Figma workspace with Flip Clock! This modern digital clock plugin lets you add a real-time flip clock to your designs, perfect for dashboards, presentations, or just keeping track of time while you work. Choose from a variety of color themes, customize the size, and decide whether to display seconds—all with a simple, intuitive interface. Whether you want a bold accent or a subtle timekeeper, Flip Clock adapts to your workflow. Stay inspired, stay on time, and make your workspace uniquely yours with Flip Clock.

plugins.name: State Machines
plugins.description:
Create state machines and integrate them directly into your designs.


What is a state machine?


Think of a state machine as a way to organize all the different "states" your design can be in. For example, a form might have states like "empty," "filled," "submitting," or "error." State machines help you clearly define these states and the rules for moving between them, making complex interactions more manageable.


---


This plugin is experimental. Contributions and feature requests welcome: github.com/colebemis/figma-state-machines

accepted.name: Cole Bemis
accepted.description: Building things for people who build things. R&D at GitHub Next

plugins.tagline: Design complex interactions with state machines

plugins.name: Design Review Notes
plugins.description:
Streamline your design review process with an easy-to-use annotation tool for Figma. Select any object or frame, add comments, and assign a review status to keep your team aligned. Statuses are:

  1. Review Needed
  2. Approved
  3. Changes Needed
  4. Not Ready


If you have suggested for additional statuses or new features, let me know.


This tool is perfect for both async teams or capturing meeting notes during design critiques, this plugin helps designers flag areas for review and allows reviewers to provide structured feedback with full traceability. Capture design decisions, document revisions, and ensure clear communication, whether for quick approvals or in-depth discussions.


✦ Mark design elements for review

✦ Assign statuses for clarity

✦ Capture feedback & decisions in context

✦ Improve async collaboration & meeting documentation


Keep your design process transparent and efficient. Try it now!
plugins.tagline: Select objects in your file to quickly annotate and add a review status.

plugins.name: Text Style Mapping
plugins.description:
Text Style Mapping simplifies the process of applying text styles to multiple text layers in your Figma designs.


Features:

  1. Apply text styles to both styled and unstyled text layers at once
  2. Automatically groups similar unstyled text based on font family, weight, size, and line height
  3. Switch between styled and unstyled text with an easy tab interface
  4. Works with your existing text styles library


How to use:

  1. Select a frame containing text elements
  2. Choose text styles from the dropdown menus
  3. Click "Apply Styles" to update all selected text layers at once


Note: This plugin may have limitations when working with text styles that use design tokens or local variables due to Figma API constraints.


This plugin helps maintain design consistency by making text styling quick and efficient across your Figma designs.


-


Text Style Mappingは、Figmaデザイン内の複数のテキストレイヤーにテキストスタイルを適用するプロセスを簡素化します。


機能：

  1. スタイル適用済みおよび未適用のテキストレイヤーに一度にスタイルを適用
  2. フォントファミリー、ウェイト、サイズ、行間に基づいて類似のスタイル未適用テキストを自動的にグループ化
  3. 使いやすいタブインターフェースでスタイル適用済みと未適用テキストを切り替え
  4. 既存のテキストスタイルライブラリと連携


使い方：

  1. テキスト要素を含むフレームを選択
  2. ドロップダウンメニューからテキストスタイルを選択
  3. 「Apply Styles」をクリックして、選択したすべてのテキストレイヤーを一度に更新


注意：このプラグインは、Figma APIの制約により、デザイントークンやローカル変数を使用するテキストスタイルでは制限がある場合があります。


このプラグインは、Figmaデザイン全体でテキストスタイリングを迅速かつ効率的に行い、デザインの一貫性を維持するのに役立ちます。
plugins.tagline: Batch apply text styles to multiple text layers in Figma.

plugins.name: Frame to JSON - AI-powered Design-to-Code Converter
plugins.description:
🎯 What is it?

A powerful Figma plugin that transforms your design frames into structured JSON data, ensuring seamless developer handoff and design-to-code consistency.


✨ Key Features

•AI-powered frame analysis

•One-click frame-to-JSON conversion

•Complete hierarchy and style preservation

•Customizable export options

•Developer-friendly structured output


🚀 How to Use

1.Select your target frame(s) in Figma

2.Launch the Frame to JSON plugin

3.Review the extracted structure and properties

4.Click “Generate JSON”

5.Copy or download the JSON output instantly


🛠️ What You’ll Need

•Figma design frames


🔒 Security Note

Your data is processed securely, with no external storage. The plugin ensures precise design-to-code conversion while maintaining full control over your export preferences. No more manual adjustments—let AI handle the complexity! ✨
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma frames into clean JSON with one click your design-to-development bridge made simple!

plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize and declutter your design files with the "Layer Sweeper" plugin.


This plugin scans your entire file to identify and delete hidden layers, frames, and groups while respecting locked layers and hidden layers within master components. If you have any suggestions or inquiries, feel free to reach out to me on Twitter.


If you appreciate my work, consider showing your support by buying me a coffee.

plugins.name: Frame Duplicator
plugins.description:
Frame Duplicator is a plugin designed to help designers and social media managers quickly create multiple posts based on CSV data and images. Perfect for batch processing posts for social media, marketing, or any other repetitive content creation tasks.


In a sentence: Choose images and upload a CSV file listing the images and any text you’d like displayed. This plugin will read your CSV, duplicate a selected frame, and insert the specified images as the background along with the provided text in designated areas.


Key Features:

CSV Integration: Automatically populate frames with text fields such as titles and subtitles based on CSV data, making it easy to maintain consistent content across multiple designs.

Image Replacement: Efficiently replace images in frames based on file names specified in the CSV, allowing you to work seamlessly with visual content.

Aspect Ratio Preservation: Ensures that images maintain their aspect ratio when resized within frames, avoiding distortion or stretching.

Batch Frame Duplication: Create multiple frames with the click of a button, with each frame populated by unique data and images from your CSV.


How to Use:

Prepare CSV and Images: Make sure your CSV file includes columns for text fields (title and subtitle) and image filenames.


Your CSV column titles must be:

title, subtitle, imageName.


Select a Frame in Figma: Choose the frame you want to duplicate.


Your Frame must include text / rectangle elements titled:

##Title ##Image ##Subtitle


Upload CSV and Images: Load your CSV and corresponding image files through the plugin’s interface.

Create Frames: Click "Create Frames" to generate frames based on the CSV data, with each frame containing unique text and images row by row.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames with text and images based on CSV data for streamlined post creation

108356.name: Frame Duplicator
108356.description:

plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

109166.name: SupaFastPages
109166.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

•Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
•Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
•Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

•Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays “Select an Option” and is disabled. When the user selects either “Sections” or “Frames,” the text changes to “Convert,” and the button becomes enabled.
•Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

•Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When “Sections” or “Frames” is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
•Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

•Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

plugins.name: Figma to BlocksIn System
plugins.description:
The BlocksIn System plugin for Figma is a game-changer for front-end development. Effortlessly convert Figma designs into React components, ready for implementation with our NPM package.


BlocksIn System - React Component Library


Here's how it simplifies your workflow:


  • Design: Create patterns using Figma components.
  • Generate: Select a frame and click 'Generate' to convert it into React markup.
  • Implement: Seamlessly integrate the code with BlocksIn System React components.
  • Reuse: Streamline your process by reusing design patterns.


Watch the video here.


Special thanks to my friend Eugenio who inspired this project. Check out his amazing work.


Get started with the BlocksIn System plugin and revolutionise your design-to-development process!
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into React BlocksIn System components effortlessly.

plugins.name: Top'n'Fix
plugins.description:
Tired of constantly switching to the prototype panel to fix a layer or frame? With the Top'n'Fix plugin, you can easily bind it to the shortcut combination of shift+opt+cmd+] and accomplish it with a single click, saving you time and effort.

Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Fixing: Instantly fix any layer or frame without the need to navigate to the prototype panel.
  2. Efficient Shortcut: Assign the shift+opt+cmd+] shortcut to quickly apply fixes with a single keystroke.


Please note that at least one object should already be fixed on the screen, fixed area in layers must be created. Hope to fix it in next version.
plugins.tagline: Fix layer, bring to the front and fix, fix frame, fix in the prototype

plugins.name: Designmate!
plugins.description:
Designmate! is your design thinking sidekick – built right into Figma.


Instead of vague scores or generic advice, Designmate! gives you concrete, context-aware feedback based on real user needs. Just drop in a screen, describe what the user is trying to do, and instantly get personalized suggestions to make your UI more usable, accessible, and delightful.


✨ What you’ll get:


  1. A clear explanation of what’s not working from a user’s perspective


  1. Specific UI/UX fixes, with exact actions to improve the screen


  1. Feedback on clarity, hierarchy, accessibility, copy, buttons, layout & more


  1. Zero BS, zero ego – just real product thinking in your Figma flow


Perfect for solo designers, founders, PMs, or teams looking to improve fast without overthinking it.
plugins.tagline: Your AI design critique buddy – smart UX/UI feedback in seconds.

plugins.name: Layer Formatter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Layer Formatter, a powerful tool that simplifies layer renaming. Whether you need hyphens, underscores, camel case, or kebab case, this tool ensures your layers align perfectly with coding conventions.


Say goodbye to messy names and hello to clean, developer-friendly files. Perfect for effortless handoff and collaboration!


✨ Key Features ✨


  1. Auto-Space Conversion: Automatically replace spaces in layer names with underscores (_) or remove them entirely for clean, code-friendly naming.
  2. Batch Rename Layers: Rename multiple layers in seconds, saving time and improving efficiency.
  3. Flexible Naming Styles: Supports hyphens, underscores, camel case, kebab case, and more to fit your coding standards.
  4. Instant Updates: Apply changes with a single click—no need for tedious manual edits.
  5. Streamlined Handoff: Deliver developer-ready files with consistent, clean layer names for seamless collaboration.
plugins.tagline: Rename layers for seamless developer handoff

plugins.name: MultiDesign Assistant
plugins.description:
MultiDesign Assistant 是一款多功能設計輔助工具，能提升 Figma 的工作效率。這個插件提供了四個實用功能：


一鍵交換填充和描邊顏色：快速切換物件的填充和描邊顏色，節省設計時間。

快速調整尺寸：輸入具體數值，一鍵調整物件的長度和寬度。

等比縮小：通過輸入自定義比例或選擇預設值，輕鬆實現物件的等比例縮小。

圓形文字標籤：為選中的文字自動添加圓形背景，完美適用於創建數字標籤等設計元素。



MultiDesign Assistant is a versatile design tool aimed at enhancing productivity for Figma users. This plugin offers four practical features:


One-click Fill and Stroke Swap: Quickly exchange the fill and stroke colors of objects, saving design time.


Quick Size Adjustment: Input specific values to instantly adjust the length and width of objects.


Proportional Scaling: Easily scale objects proportionally by entering custom ratios or selecting from preset values.


Circular Text Labels: Automatically add circular backgrounds to selected text, perfect for creating number tags and similar design elements.
plugins.tagline: Swap colors, adjust sizes, scale proportionally, add circular text backgrounds.

With instant access to the full Eva Icons library — fully free and open-source — you can seamlessly search, preview, and insert icons right into your projects with just a click. 🚀


No need to leave Figma or waste time downloading SVGs manually. This plugin helps you stay in your creative flow while keeping your UI sharp, modern, and on-brand. 🌟 Whether you're designing dashboards, mobile apps, or websites, Eva Icons deliver clarity and elegance in every pixel. ✅

plugins.name: TRANS-AI
plugins.description:
TRANS-AI helps designers create multilingual designs by translating text layers and automatically adjusting layouts for right-to-left languages.


Key Features:

  1. Translate selected text layers using OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini API (bring your own API key)
  2. One-click layout conversion between RTL and LTR designs
  3. Option to automatically adjust layouts when translating to/from RTL languages
  4. Exclude specific layers from translation using the layer name filter
  5. Preserves text formatting while converting layouts


Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.
plugins.tagline: Go global in seconds! AI-powered translation with smart RTL/LTR layout conversion.

133981.name: TRANS-AI
133981.description:

Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.

plugins.name: Console CLI
plugins.description:
Console CLI lets you control Figma using commands. You can list fonts, styles, and components, create shapes, get details about selected elements, check file analytics, and view user info.


Commands:

  1. help : See available commands
  2. ls : Lists data related to fonts, styles, or components
  3. ls fonts : List all fonts used in the file
  4. ls styles : List all styles used in file file
  5. ls components : List all components in the file
  6. shape : Create a new shapes based on the specified type
  7. shape rect <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create rectangle
  8. shape circle <diameter> [x] [y] : Create circle
  9. shape ellipse <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create ellipse
  10. shape polygon <sides> <radius> [x] [y] : Create polygon
  11. shape star <points> <outer-radius> <inner-radius> [x] [y] : Create star
  12. selection : Info about the currently selected nodes
  13. selection --verbose : Additional details about the selection
  14. analytics : Retrieve file analytics
  15. whoami : Retrieves info about the current user
  16. clear : Clear the console
  17. exit : Close the plugin
plugins.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

127623.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

plugins.name: Text Style Usage Analyzer
plugins.description: Analyze and visualize the usage of text styles in your Figma project. This plugin lists all text styles (even unused ones), sorts them by usage, and displays a bar chart next to each style. Green bars indicate high usage, yellow for medium, and red for zero usage. Perfect for cleaning up unused styles and optimizing your design system.

plugins.name: CopyMate - Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting
plugins.description:
Streamline your copywriting process without leaving Figma. CopyMate helps designers and writers enhance, translate, and refine UX copy in seconds while maintaining clarity, brand tone, and design consistency.


Enhance your copywriting ✍️

Improve writing quality with AI-powered suggestions that:

- Align with brand guidelines

- Improve clarity and readability

- Preserve original capitalization


Shorten Text Without Losing Meaning ✂️

Make text more concise while keeping intent and usability intact—perfect for button labels, tooltips, and UI elements.


Translate Text Instantly 🌍

Convert selected text into multiple languages while preserving formatting.


How CopyMate works

1. Select one or more text layers

2. Run CopyMate from the Figma plugin menu

3. Choose an action: Translate, Enhance, Shorten, or Quality Check

4. Review & Apply your changes instantly


Try CopyMate now and supercharge your copywriting workflow! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting

plugins.name: Sierotki Eliminator
plugins.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
plugins.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

105512.name: Sierotki Eliminator
105512.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
105512.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

114360.name: Find and Replace Screens
114360.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
114360.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

plugins.name: Fontastic
plugins.description:
Find the fonts you can't locate, hidden in unknown or messy files.


Have you ever opened a project only to find you have no idea what fonts were used? With our plugin, you can quickly and easily locate those hidden typefaces that complicate your work. Forget digging through messy files and wasting valuable time—uncover what once seemed impossible with just one click. Make your workflow faster and more efficient! ⚡


  1. 🔎 Have you been handed a file with no clues about its fonts?
  2. ⚡️ Are you looking to save hours of work while reviewing text?
  3. 🤖 Would you like an assistant that reveals hidden fonts in a single click?


Say goodbye to frustration and hello to a smoother creative process! 🎉
plugins.tagline: Find the fonts you can't locate, hidden in unknown files or messy archives.
